7.28.19  6:12 pm   few questions. first of all, at (https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201907141711) you said, and I quote "i have never received any question more than once", but you do have dedicated pages to specific questions you get a lot such as "Has Anyone Really Been Far Even as Decided to Use Even Go Want to do Look More Like?" or "what is the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow", showing clearly you do get multiple of what is essentially the same question. Explain?

Â Â Â Â Â actually due to the enormulogantically massive quantitative amounts of the same questions(s) i've gotten, in this instance i've resorted to fiction/humour to pass the time in a more flavourful manner

      also what happened to the c major scale t-shirt

Â Â Â Â Â too good. can't sell

      also also what do you think of The Lick

Â Â Â Â Â put it this way, it didn't get where it is today by being weak

7.28.19  4:58 pm   how do i know when people want to listen to what i am saying instead of having me be quiet, i can be soooo into what im saying that I project my own excitement for the topic to everyone

Â Â Â Â Â  it's just like most things in life, it's like walking on thin ice. sometimes you have to just walk and be brave. and sometimes, whoa, hold on, stop and be careful. you'll know you're doing it right when you've done a little bit of both each day

7.28.19  3:34 pm   hi i hope ur doing ok bud also how do owls fly

Â Â Â Â Â  they've got to do it backwards or something

7.28.19  3:27 pm   i mean, you must have to deal with ordinary things while deeply into a long creative endeavor.  People who like, want to go out to lunch, but you really are right in the middle of this very small but important detail that needs to be just right before you can even think about taking a break, and it could be hours.

Â Â Â Â Â  i go to lunch alone. i don't do lunch meetings. i try to schedule meetings before or after lunch. also i should mention that i call every meal lunch. that's one of the joys of making your own lunch schedule

7.28.19  3:23 pm   how to balance being an obsessive perfectionist in an art with normal people who do not understand why i may be spending 18 hours working on a project today?

Â Â Â Â Â  when balance is achieved, you may be relatively far away from them

7.28.19  1:02 pm   hello bill. do you still edit without a mouse/trackpad?

Â Â Â Â Â  i've always had and used a mouse/trackpad, in some ways that are valuable and in some ways that i always wished i could use keyboard -- like specifically when i am using the mouse to move to a fake button and virtual press it via the mouse. that's when you know something's wrong. but as we speak i am making great strides. as i'm doing questions, what used to be complex mouse moves are now as quick as punching an order at burger king

7.28.19  12:00 pm   Can you answer a question inside a question inside a question inside a question?

Â Â Â Â Â  yes

7.28.19  11:57 am   every time i think i'm creating a song or writing a chord progression that came to my mind i end up realizing that it already exists and i was basically transcribing it. how do you deal with it? has this ever happened to you? 

Â Â Â Â Â  if it's just chords, you usually won't have to worry about it. everyone is allowed to use the same chords (and they do). if it's a melody, ........ well ............ if your melody is simple enough, it's almost guaranteed that someone has done it before, and that will be ok as long as they don't catch you making a ton of money with it. but, if you want to be sure you are doing something original, all you have to do is give it some nudges in some peculiar directions. put on a funny hat, mess it up a little. then just try and find your way back home as normal. does the trick every time

7.28.19  11:47 am   what percentage of the new video is already made?

Â Â Â Â Â  there is a music video with the audio 100% finalized, and the visual is maybe at about 20%

Â Â Â Â Â  that's normal

Â Â Â Â Â  now you need hosting

Â Â Â Â Â  not that i know of

7.28.19  8:37 am   do you have any advice for an aspiring musician who's a little worried about the financial side of 'trying to make a living from music'?

Â Â Â Â Â you can either get a non-music job, or a music job

      i'm a little worried that if i try to put all my eggs in one basket it won't work out and i'll be kinda stranded,

Â Â Â Â Â no you won't, at that point you can just get a non-music job

      but at the same time i'm not sure that i'd be able to balance having a more stable career and also doing music work,

Â Â Â Â Â balancing things will make you stronger, more nimble, and innovative

      so it feels like i'm kinda stuck no matter what i do, and i figured you might be able to help as someone who's (probably) had to make the same decision

Â Â Â Â Â  you can try getting a non-music job or a music job. depending on your mindset, you might be more tolerant of one or the other. over time this could even change. but that's ok, you can change your job accordingly

7.28.19  6:15 am   What's you main source of income?

Â Â Â Â Â  suing myself for identity theft

7.28.19  5:34 am   7.27.19  9:46 pm you mentioned on some interview you did recently (at least i think it was recent, it was on twitch and they don't keep stuff up on there long), you advised pretending to be as successful as you want to be/act like you have the audience you want to have, which i think can be summed up as "Fake It Til You Make It". what do you think? thanks for the other tips btw, but what if my own tastes are really niche?

Â Â Â Â Â do you actually think you are capable of making something that a lot of other people like but you don't? how would you even know what you're doing? that's like painting a picture using colors that you can't even see

      i definitely want to make stuff i personally would enjoy, but i want my stuff to be enjoyed by as many people as possible, and i'm definitely not most people. it's a good start though, i think i'll begin the "Make Content For You" diet right....now!

Â Â Â Â Â there's nothing anyone can really do to ensure that. the only thing you can do is try your best, and you will still think you are not there yet, when all of a sudden people will start asking you how you got there

7.27.19  9:46 pm   so Basically Bill what you're telling me is that i need to follow the "Fake It Til You Make It" diet if i wish to create content for people.

Â Â Â Â Â i don't recall saying that

      any other diets you can recommend for this end?

Â Â Â Â Â you could try only round foods. things shaped like balls

      i have heard good things about the "Make Things People Enjoy" and "Practise Making Content Every Day" diets.

Â Â Â Â Â  i don't know any direct reliable way to make things people enjoy, other than to make something yourself enjoys, and hold on to hope that perhaps you may share some similar taste with your planetmates
